intro: Saccolabiopsis papuana, commonly known as the Papuan saccolabiopsis, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific islands, particularly New Guinea. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its distinctive blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are upright and slender. Saccolabiopsis papuana is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution.
